[...] Bentkowska-Kafel, Anna 2015-02-28T13:42:41+00:00 2015-02-28T13:42:41+00:00 Colour and Space in Cultural Heritage | Publication opportunities https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHART;b5e6a609.1502 Contributions are invited for immediate and future peer-reviewed publication by Colour and Space in Cultural Heritage, www.cosch.info<br><br>COSCH is an interdisciplinary European network of experts in and users of the latest optical measuring techniques and imaging used in recording, examination and visualisation of artefacts. COSCH aims to enhance the existing practice and standards in 3D documentation, by promoting a better understanding of science, widening access and use of specialist technologies. For further details, please see the email below.<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Vicky Brown, Visual Resources Curator<br>History of Art Department, University of Oxford<br>Suite 9, Littlegate House<br>St Ebbes<br>Oxford OX1 1PT<br>UK<br><br>+44 (0)1865 286839<br>victoria.brown@hoa.ox.ac.uk<mailto:victoria.brown@hoa.ox.ac.uk><br><br>The University of Oxford is a 10:10 University ARLIS Committee for Art & Design Archives 2015-01-26T14:22:11+00:00 2015-01-26T14:22:11+00:00 ARLIS Committee for Art & Design Archives, Copyright Study Day https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHART;c23f1fa6.1501 Keeping Within the Lines: Approaches to Copyright in Art and Design Archives<br><br>London Metropolitan Archives, London<br>Friday 13 March, 10.15am - 5pm<br><br>Organised by ARLIS/UK & Ireland, Committee for Art & Design Archives (CADA) in partnership with The National Archives and the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdArchiving the Arts\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd initiative.<br><br>A study day comprising presentations, panel discussions and a practical workshop, focusing on copyright and other legal issues in relation to the use of art and design archives. Expert speakers will explore the principles of copyright presented by current legislation and thinking, and discuss the issues, challenges and opportunities of using copyright-protected archive material [...] Bluemm, Mirjam 2015-01-23T16:54:03+00:00 2015-01-23T16:54:03+00:00 New Digital Humanities film "Digital Knowledge Spaces" https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHART;57fed58.1501 Dear Sir or Madam, dear Colleagues,<br><br>The projects DARIAH-DE (https://de.dariah.eu<https://de.dariah.eu/>/) and TextGrid (http://www.textgrid.de<http://www.textgrid.de/>/) have just released a sequel to the first Digital Humanities film Virtual Research Worlds<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BY9XqXJMbc8> (2012) in an English and German version.<br><br>The Digital Humanities have established their place in the humanities and are inspiring new research questions, approaches and discoveries. [...] DAH Journal 2015-01-08T11:08:55+01:00 2015-01-08T11:08:55+01:00 CALL FOR MANUSCRIPTS: International Journal for Digital Art History https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHART;9da15431.1501 Call for Manuscripts<br><br>The Digital Age has revolutionized economy, society and our private lives. For decades now, digitalization has also touched most branches of the humanities. With the rising importance of the so called Digital Humanities, Art History is about to change significantly. Since the slide library is irreversibly replaced by image databases, the fact that our media have turned digital opens up to new possibilities. Academic books and journals are increasingly accessed and published via internet. Data-driven approaches enable us to visualize large data-sets and big image data. Computer vision, gamification and citizen science spur new epistemic approaches. [...] Bentkowska-Kafel, Anna 2014-11-13T03:37:08+00:00 2014-11-13T03:37:08+00:00 COSCH Session at CAA 2015 Siena | Call for Papers https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHART;962c2e60.1411 Colour and Space in Cultural Heritage: Interdisciplinary Connections<br><br>COSCH session at the CAA 2015 Conference in Siena<br><br>30 March-3 April 2015<br><br>http://caaconference.org/program/sessions/6d/<br><br>The COST Action 'Colour and Space in Cultural Heritage' invites papers and posters addressing key interdisciplinary questions - scientific and technological, theoretical and practical - concerning the development and use of optical measuring techniques and electronic imaging, applied to documentation and presentation of artefacts. Electronic art; Imaging technology; Visualising the<br>body; Communities and the digital; Visualising landscapes; EU project<br>workshops; Research Workshop;<br><http://www.eva-london.org/eva-london-2014/programme/research-workshop> and<br>much more <http://www.eva-london.org/eva-london-2014/programme/programme>.<br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdPrizes<br><http://www.eva-london.org/eva-london-2014/eva-london-2014/prizes>Prizes<br>for the best paper and the best demo will be selected by popular vote.<br>Ashgate are again sponsoring a prize for the best paper and Imperica<br>digital arts magazine [...] Bentkowska-Kafel, Anna 2014-06-06T07:10:17+00:00 2014-06-06T07:10:17+00:00 Digital Heritage 2014, University of York, UK, 12 July 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHART;3c4a82a1.1406 The Centre for Digital Heritage at the University of York are pleased to<br>announce that registration for Digital Heritage 2014 is now open.<br><br>The conference will be held at the University of York on the 12th of July<br>and the theme this year is 'Digital Communities in Action'. the programme features a range of exciting papers from across the academic and professional sectors. [...] Bentkowska-Kafel, Anna 2014-06-06T07:06:15+00:00 2014-06-06T07:06:15+00:00 The State of 3D Modeling of Cultural Heritage, Vienna, Nov. 3-5, 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHART;b8e52770.1406 SPECIAL CALL FOR SPECIAL SESSION AT CHNT, Vienna, Nov. 3-5, 2014 "The State of 3D Modeling of Cultural Heritage in the Age of Augmented Reality, Xbox Kinect, UAVs, and the Oculus Rift" The purpose of this session is to take stock of the current state of the art of 3D modeling of cultural heritage objects of all scales (from a vase or statue, to a building or an entire landscape). It seems particularly opportune to do so in light of the dramatically lower costs of devices for 3D data capture and display. Papers fitting one or more of the following [...] Bentkowska-Kafel, Anna 2014-05-24T20:00:09+00:00 2014-05-24T20:00:09+00:00 Extended CfP | CHArt conference @ King's College London Arts & Humanties Festival, 18th Oct 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CHART;fe05f6a8.1405 *** CALL FOR PAPERS AND DEMONSTRATIONS ***<br>Extended deadline: Friday, 30 May 2014<br><br>Conformity, Process and Deviation: Digital Arts as ‘Outsider’<br><br>CHArt 2014 conference, part of the UNDERGROUND<br>Arts & Humanities Festival, King’s College London, Strand<br>Saturday, 18 October 2014<br><br>Digital engagement with art is thriving. Much of it is actively subversive of the traditional frameworks that enable art to be created and responded to \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd whether casually or professionally. This subversion takes various forms, including notions of value, uniqueness, fixity and location.
